module.description: VPBE Video Encoder / Digital LCD Subsystem (spec version: 1.00.w.02b)

bitfield.description: Digital video output mode
Non-interlace line number select Effective in standard SDTV non-interlace mode (VMD=0, HDMD=0, ITLC=1).
Interlaced Scan Mode Enable Effective in standard SDTV mode (VMD=0, HDMD=0)
Nonstandard interlace mode Effective in non-standard mode (VMD=1).
HDTV mode Effective in standard mode (VMD=0).
TV Format Type Select Effective in standard mode (VMD=0). SDTV mode (HDMD=0) HDTV mode (HDMD=1)
Master-slave select
Video timing
Blanking enable Sync signal and color burst are still output
Composite Analog Output Enable
Video Encoder Enable
VCLK output polarity
VCLK output enable Note: Setting 1 outputs DCLK from VCLK pin. When 0 VCLKP setting is still available
VCLK pin output enable
Horizontal / Vertical Sync pin I/O control Set to 1 when external syncs are input Default is 1(input)
Digital data output mode
Swaps YOUT/COUT pins Interchanges the output data of YOUT and COUT
YOUT / COUT pin output level Setting DC out option will output the value in the YCOLVL register on YOUT/COUT pins. Effective only when YOUT/COUT pin is set as output (YCDIR=0).

YOUT / COUT pin output mode Setting DV out will output the digital video output generated in video encoder on the YOUT/COUT pins. Setting Through Mode directly outputs the data from the YIN/CIN pins on the YOUT/COUT pins.

YOUT / COUT pin direction Note: YOUT/COUT pin is used as YC data input pin for CCDC. Set '0' for digital video output In Input Mode, YOUT/COUT pins are used as YC data input pins for CCDC. Set to Outptu Mode for digital video output. When UDISP digital video output mode is selected (VOMD=6), COUT[1:0] pins are always set to input.
C Prefilter select Note: When PFLTR and PFLTC are '1', use PFLTY to 1 to adjust delay between Y and C. When other combinations are selected, the delay is adjusted automatically on hardware.
Y Prefilter select Note: When PFLTR and PFLTY are '1', use PFLTC to 1 to adjust delay between Y and C. When other combinations are selected, the delay is adjusted automatically on hardware.
Prefilter sampling frequency
Color Bar Type
Color bar mode
Input video Attenuation control for RGB
Input video Attenuation control for YCbCr
Input video Attenuation control for composite
DAC x2 up-sampling enable
C signal up-sampling enable
Y signal up-sampling enable
OSD vsync delay
External field detection mode Effective in slave operation (SLAVE=1).

bitenum.description: latch ext. field at external VD rising edge
use external vsync as field ID

bitfield.description: External field input inversion Effective in slave operation (SLAVE=1). External field
External sync select
External vertical sync input polarity
External horizontal sync input polarity
Composite signal output polarity Note: Specifies composite signal output polarity from COUT3 pin in YCC8 or RGB8 mode
Composite signal output enable Note: Specifies composite signal output polarity from COUT3 pin in YCC8 or RGB8 mode
Output sync select Note: Applicable to Standard mode only Setting '1' in standard mode outputs the pulse width processed by the SYNCPLS register as output sync signal.
Vertical sync output signal
Vertical sync output polarity
Horizontal sync output polarity
Vertical sync output enable The output comes to ON when this is set to 1, and the signal selected by the VSSW is output from VSYNC pin. Setting 0 outputs inactive level determined by VPL.
Horizontal sync output enable The output comes to ON when this is set to 1, and the signal selected by the VSSW is output from HSYNC pin. Setting 0 outputs inactive level determined by HPL.
Horizontal sync pulse width (no of ENC clocks) Note: Effective in non-standard mode or sync processing mode (SYSW = 1)
Vertical sync pulse width (no of ENC clocks) Note: Effective in non-standard mode or sync processing mode (SYSW = 1)
Horizontal interval (no of ENC clocks) Note: Effective in non-standard mode, If OSD clock is (ENC clock / 2), Specify even values. Interval is HINT+1
Horizontal valid data start position Note: Specify number of ENC clocks from start of horizontal sync. LCD_OE is asserted at the position specified here and the data output starts.
Horizontal data valid range Note: specify number of ENC clocks. LCD_OE is asserted during the period specified here and valid data is output. The data outside of valid range is output in L.
Vertical interval (no of lines) Note: Effective in non-standard mode The interval is represented by VINT+1
Vertical valid data start position Note: Specify number of lines
Vertical data valid range Note: specify number of lines
Output delay of horizontal sync signal Note: This will delay the HSYNC signal by ENC clock
Output delay of vertical sync signal Note: This will delay the VSYNC signal by ENC clock
YC output order Based on YCC mode
REC656 mode This is ITU-R BT.656 format and is effective when the OSD clock runs at ENC clock/2.
RGB latch setting Set 1 to latch and output the data input in serial RGB output. This is set when data with the same pixel are output serially.
Swap order of data output in IronMan mode Effective only IRONM=1

IronMan 9bit mode Effective only IRONM=1. When 1, 24-bit RGB data (upper 6-bits of each color) is serially output on 9-bit data bus. The output format is the first is R[7:2] and G[7:5] and the second is G[4:2] and B[7:2]. This order can be swapped by IRSWP register.
Iron-man type RGB output Effective in SRGB mode
RGB LPF sampling frequency Effective in all digital output modes with RGB output Note: Effective in all digital modes with RGB output
RGB LPF select Note: Effective in all digital modes with RGB output

RGB output order (Line Id = 1) Note: Effective in RGB8, EPSON and CASIO modes. The line ID at RGBCL=1 represents the culling line ID set in the CULLLINE register. At RGBCL=0, it represents normal line ID.

RGB output order (Line Id = 0) Note: Effective in RGB8, EPSON and CASIO modes. The line ID at RGBCL=1 represents the culling line ID set in the CULLLINE register. At RGBCL=0, it represents normal line ID.
Upper clip level for RGB output Note: Effective in all digital output modes with RGB output. Clipping is done following offset addition
Offset level for RGB output Note: Effective in all digital output modes with RGB output. Offset specified here can be added to RGB converted from YCbCr
External Line Id signal polarity Effective at EXIDE=1
External Line Id signal input mode Set External to perform the line control using external line ID signal, which can be input from a GIO. Otehrwise, the line ID is generated internally.
Vertical data valid start position field mode When 1, different start line can be specified for vertical data valid start position by VSTARTA register.
Vertical Culling line position Specifies which line will be culled of every six lines. No culling will be applied when VCLID is greater than 5. This bit is effective when VCL56=1.
Vertical Culling counter reset mode When 0, the counter for vertical culling is reset to zero at vertical sync. When 1, it is reset to a random value at vertical sync. Effective when VCL56=1.
Digital output vertical culling Enabling discards one line of video output every six lines. This can be used to output NTSC valid lines with PAL timing.

Digital output Field Hold Note: Effective in non-standard mode. Enabling suspends the video output when current field output is completed. Reading the data from OSD is suspended during this period and the output of sync signal and video data ar

Digital output Line Hold Note: Effective in non-standard mode. Enabling suspends the video output when current line output is completed. Reading the data from OSD is suspended during this period and the output of sync signal and video data are al
Start line Id control in even field

DCLK pattern switching by culling line Id When this is enabled, the DCLK pattern can be switched according to the culling line ID set by the CULLLINE register. The DCLK pattern on each line is specified by the DCLKPTN and DCLKPTNA registers.

DCLK polarity inversion by culling line Id When this is disabled, the DCLK polarity is fixed anytime as specified by the VCLKP register. Enabling inverts this polarity according to the culling line ID set by the CULLLINE register.

RGB output order switching by culling line Id Disabling switches RGB output order every line. Enabling switches this order according to the XORed signal of the line ID and the culling line ID set by the CULLLINE register. The output order on each
Culling line Id toggle position (Odd field)
Culling line Id toggle position (Even field)
Culling line Id inversion interval
GIO39 output signal select Note: Select GIO29 signal using FSEL2[11:10] = 01
Field Id output polarity
PWM output pulse polarity
PWM output control
LCD_AC output control
Bright output polarity
Bright output control
LCD_OE output polarity
LCD_OE output control
Bright pulse start position Specify the number of ENC cycles from HSYNC signal.
Bright pulse width Specify the number of ENC cycles.
LCD_AC toggle interval Note: LCD_AC is toggled every field specified here
LCD_AC toggle horizontal position Note: LCD_AC is toggled by the number of ENC clocks from the rising edge of horizontal sync signal
PWM output period Specify the number of ENC clocks. Period is PWMP + 1
PWM output pulse width Specify the H pulse width by ENC clock. Setting '0' makes PWM output L level always, Setting bigger value than PWMP sets to H level always,

DCLK Internal Mode When enabled, a different pattern can be specified for internal DCLK from output DCLK. In this mode, DCLKPTN0A-PCLKPTN3A and DCLKHSTTA are used to specify the internal DCLK pattern and its pattern valid bit width respectively. Th
DCLK output offset To adjust the DCLK delay output from VCLK pin by ENC clock. When DCLK output is configured as ENC clock gating with DCKEC=1 and DCKOH=0, these bits have no meaning.
DCLK Pattern mode When 0, the specified value in DCLKPTN (or DCLKPTNA) register becomes the clock level of DCLK. When 1, DCLKPTN works as the clock enable for ENC clock.

DCLK mask control Masks are specified by the DCLKHSTT, DCLKHVLD, DCLKVSTT and DCLKVVLD registers. Enabling represents the mask is ON and outputs the clock in specified valid area. Disabling represents the mask is OFF and outputs directly the DCLK

DCLK output divide Enabling divides the clock by two and outputs it from VCLK pin. RGB data is output by the rising of internal DCLK and only divided clock output is output. Thus, this can be used to connect to the LCD that captures the data usin

Internal DCLK output divide Enabling divides internal DCLK clock by two. When the clock output is divided by 1 (DCKOH=0), two clocks can be output per one data. Thus, this can be used to connect to the LCD that requires double clock frequency of d
DCLK pattern valid bit width Note: Set the width of valid bits aming 64 bits in the DCLKPTN0-3 registers
DCLK pattern The specified bit pattern is output in resolution of ENC clock units
DCLK pattern The specified bit pattern is output in resolution of ENC clock units
DCLK pattern The specified bit pattern is output in resolution of ENC clock units
DCLK pattern The specified bit pattern is output in resolution of ENC clock units
DCLK pattern (auxiliary) The specified bit pattern is output in resolution of ENC clock units
DCLK pattern (auxiliary) The specified bit pattern is output in resolution of ENC clock units
DCLK pattern (auxiliary) The specified bit pattern is output in resolution of ENC clock units
DCLK pattern (auxiliary) The specified bit pattern is output in resolution of ENC clock units
Horizontal DCLK mask start position This is specified in number of ENC clocks from start of the horizontal sync signal
Horizontal DCLK (auxiliary) mask start position This is specified in number of ENC clocks from start of the horizontal sync signal
Horizontal DCLK mask range This is specified in ENC clocks
DCLK vertival mask start position This is specified in lines from vertical sync signal
DCLK vertical mask range This is specified in number of lines
Video attribute data register 0 NTSC - Set the WORD0 data. - Bit7-6 is unused, - Bit5-3 is WORD0-B, - Bit2-0 is WORD0-A PAL - not used
Video attribute data register 1 NTSC - Set the WORD1 and WORD2 data - Bit7-4 is WORD2, - Bit3-0 is WORD1 PAL - Set the GROUP1 and GROUP2 data. - Bit7-4 is GROUP2, - Bit3-0 is GROUP1

Video attribute data register 2 NTSC - Set CRC data and enable attribute insertion. - Bit7 is ATR_EN, - Bit6 is unused, - Bit5-0 is CRC PAL - Set GROUP3 and GROU4 data and enable attribute insertion. - Bit7 is ATR_EN, - Bit6 is ununsed, - Bit5-3 is GROUP4 and - Bit2-0 is GROUP3 ATR_EN: Attribute data insertion enable 0: No insertion 1: Insertion
Low pulse number of YSCL
XINH Signal select
XINH DC level
SYS function applied field ID select
SYS function enable Note: setting '1 resets the vertical counter one line earlier in the field selected by SYSFID
GCP pattern select Note: When RAM is used, data written in RAM address 0-63 is shifter out by one bit from MSB to LSB and output as GCP pulse
RIT port control Note: Setting is enabled at the rising edge of horizontal sync signal
STBYB port control Note: CP output is fixed at H level when 0
GRES port control
Display mode
Frame start pulse width This is Specified in ENC clocks
FRC table rotation enable When enabled, the FRC table for each color is automatically rotated when each pixel data is latched. This can be useful to equalize dot blinking pattern.
STN-LCD data bus width
Field ID monitor
uDisplay 'Balance signal' monitor
uDisplay 'Full' signal monitor
GCP/FRC table RAM address.

RAM data port Note: While reading, the data in the address specified in the RAMADR register can be read. While writing, the data is written to the address specified in the RAMADR register. The RAMADR is automatically incremented every access to the RAMP register in both write and read cases.
DAC3 power-down
DAC2 power-down
DAC1 power-down
DAC0 power-down
DAC DC output mode Note: Enabling converts the value written in the DALVL register to DAC and directly outputs from DAOUT
DC level control
YOUT DC level
COUT DC level
Sub-carrier initial phase value Phase in degrees specified by SCSD/1024*360
Delay adjsutment of Y signal in composite signal Note: The value represented is 2's complement
Composite video level (sync/white)
Setup level at NTSC output
Blanking shape disable
Chroma signal low pass filter select
Blanking build up time for composite output
Sync build up time for composite output
RGB Mode select for component output
Delay adjsutment of Y signal in component mode Note: The value represented is 2's complement
Sync on Pr (or R)
Sync on Pb (or B)
Sync on Y (or G)
Chroma level for component YPbPr
Luma level (sync/white) for component YPbPr
Setup for component YPbPr
Blanking shape disable When 1, blanking shaping feature is disabled.
Blanking build up time for component output (interlace)
Sync build up time for component output (interlace) (interlace)
Equalizing pulse width offset for composite output This is set by ENC clock. This register is represented as signed-integer (2's complement).
Field sync pulse width offset for composite output This is set by ENC clock. This register is represented as signed-integer (2's complement).
Line sync pulse width offset for composite output This is set by ENC clock. This register is represented as signed-integer (2's complement).
Burst end position offset for composite output This is set by ENC clock. This register is represented as signed-integer (2's complement).
Burst start position offset for composite output This is set by ENC clock. This register is represented as signed-integer (2's complement).
Front porch position offset for composite output This is set by ENC clock. This register is represented as signed-integer (2's complement).
Line blanking end position offset for composite output This is set by ENC clock. This register is represented as signed-integer (2's complement).
Equalizing pulse width offset for component output This is set by ENC clock. This register is represented as signed-integer (2's complement).
Field sync pulse width offset for component output This is set by ENC clock. This register is represented as signed-integer (2's complement).
Line sync pulse width offset for component output This is set by ENC clock. This register is represented as signed-integer (2's complement).
Front porch position offset for component output This is set by ENC clock. This register is represented as signed-integer (2's complement).
Line blanking end position offset for component output This is set by ENC clock. This register is represented as signed-integer (2's complement).
DAC3 output select
DAC2 output select
DAC1 output select
DAC0 output select

YCbCr->RGB matrix coefficient GY for analog RGB out Equation: | R | | GY 0 RV | | Y-16 | | G | = 1/512 | GY -GU -GV | | Cb-128 | | B | | GY BU 0 | | Cr-128 | Default: | R | | 512 0 702 | | Y-16 | | G | = 1/512 | 512 -172 -357 | | Cb-128 | | B | | 512 887 0 | | Cr-128 |

YCbCr->RGB matrix coefficient RV for analog RGB out Equation: | R | | GY 0 RV | | Y-16 | | G | = 1/512 | GY -GU -GV | | Cb-128 | | B | | GY BU 0 | | Cr-128 | Default: | R | | 512 0 702 | | Y-16 | | G | = 1/512 | 512 -172 -357 | | Cb-128 | | B | | 512 887 0 | | Cr-128 |

YCbCr->RGB matrix coefficient GU for analog RGB out Equation: | R | | GY 0 RV | | Y-16 | | G | = 1/512 | GY -GU -GV | | Cb-128 | | B | | GY BU 0 | | Cr-128 | Default: | R | | 512 0 702 | | Y-16 | | G | = 1/512 | 512 -172 -357 | | Cb-128 | | B | | 512 887 0 | | Cr-128 |

YCbCr->RGB matrix coefficient GV for analog RGB out Equation: | R | | GY 0 RV | | Y-16 | | G | = 1/512 | GY -GU -GV | | Cb-128 | | B | | GY BU 0 | | Cr-128 | Default: | R | | 512 0 702 | | Y-16 | | G | = 1/512 | 512 -172 -357 | | Cb-128 | | B | | 512 887 0 | | Cr-128 |

YCbCr->RGB matrix coefficient BU for analog RGB out Equation: | R | | GY 0 RV | | Y-16 | | G | = 1/512 | GY -GU -GV | | Cb-128 | | B | | GY BU 0 | | Cr-128 | Default: | R | | 512 0 702 | | Y-16 | | G | = 1/512 | 512 -172 -357 | | Cb-128 | | B | | 512 887 0 | | Cr-128 |

YCbCr->RGB matrix coefficient GY for Digital RGB out Equation: | R | | GY 0 RV | | Y-16 | | G | = 1/512 | GY -GU -GV | | Cb-128 | | B | | GY BU 0 | | Cr-128 | Default: | R | | 512 0 702 | | Y-16 | | G | = 1/512 | 512 -172 -357 | | Cb-128 | | B | | 512 887 0 | | Cr-128 |

YCbCr->RGB matrix coefficient RV for Digital RGB out Equation: | R | | GY 0 RV | | Y-16 | | G | = 1/512 | GY -GU -GV | | Cb-128 | | B | | GY BU 0 | | Cr-128 | Default: | R | | 512 0 702 | | Y-16 | | G | = 1/512 | 512 -172 -357 | | Cb-128 | | B | | 512 887 0 | | Cr-128 |

YCbCr->RGB matrix coefficient GU for Digital RGB out Equation: | R | | GY 0 RV | | Y-16 | | G | = 1/512 | GY -GU -GV | | Cb-128 | | B | | GY BU 0 | | Cr-128 | Default: | R | | 512 0 702 | | Y-16 | | G | = 1/512 | 512 -172 -357 | | Cb-128 | | B | | 512 887 0 | | Cr-128 |

YCbCr->RGB matrix coefficient GV for Digital RGB out Equation: | R | | GY 0 RV | | Y-16 | | G | = 1/512 | GY -GU -GV | | Cb-128 | | B | | GY BU 0 | | Cr-128 | Default: | R | | 512 0 702 | | Y-16 | | G | = 1/512 | 512 -172 -357 | | Cb-128 | | B | | 512 887 0 | | Cr-128 |

YCbCr->RGB matrix coefficient BU for Digital RGB out Equation: | R | | GY 0 RV | | Y-16 | | G | = 1/512 | GY -GU -GV | | Cb-128 | | B | | GY BU 0 | | Cr-128 | Default: | R | | 512 0 702 | | Y-16 | | G | = 1/512 | 512 -172 -357 | | Cb-128 | | B | | 512 887 0 | | Cr-128 |

register.description: Vertical data valid start position for even field

bitfield.description: Vertical data valid start position for even field Specify the number of lines
OSD clock pattern bit width Sets the width of valid bit among all 16 bits in the OSDCLK1 register. The number of the valid bits is counted from LSB side to MSB side of the OSDCLK1.
OSD clock pattern
Horizontal valid culling mode When enabled, the LCD_OE signal is gated by the pattern specified by HCPT register.
Horizontal valid culling pattern bit width Set the width of valid bit among all 16 bits in the HVLDCL1 register. The number of the valid bits is counted from LSB side to MSB side of the HVLDCL1.
Horizontal culling pattern

OSD horizontal sync advance OSD horizontal sync assertion timing can be advanced by this register. By default, the timing is adjusted so that OSD timing related registers and VENC timing related registers are aligned. Specify the number of ENC cloc
Sub-carrier frequency parameter 0 See VTEST0 register for equation
Sub-carrier frequency parameter 1 See VTEST0 register for equation (2s complement within 16-bit field, default is -25)
Sub-carrier frequency parameter 2 See VTEST0 register for equation
DAC cell DEMEN control
DAC cell Output Enable (OE) control
Interrupt factor
VENC AC test mode For device testing

FRC table preset Setting '1' presets the FRC table to 0-15 addresses in RAM. As preset value, that of LCD controller 'ML87V3104' manufactured by OKI is applied. Writing '0' performs no function. At reading, '0' is read all the time.
VENC register set Setting '1' resets the VENC register to default setting. Writing '0' performs no function. At reading, '0' is read all the time.
Timing at PAL signal output
Field ID inversion for Macrovision circuit
Macrovision Y signal step output function enable This is ON by default
Macrovision register reset Setting '1' resets the Macrovision register to default setting depending on current NTSC/PAL mode. Writing '0' performs no function. At reading, '0' is read all the time.

Sub-carrier phase reset - Writing 1 resets the sub-carrier phase - Writing 0 has no function - Always 0 when read Sub-carrier frequency can be derived by SRATE?SCCN and SCCP registers by the following: f_sc = 1/1024 x (SRATE - SCCN/(SCCP-SCCN)) x 27MHz
Y LPF Enable To apply 1+2+1 filter to Y signal in 13.5MHz sampling rate. (For test for DSC25-compatible)
Chroma LPF OFF
Luma upsampling filter select
